alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Lakeshore (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 23 at 9:27PM EDT until August 24 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Ohio and northwest Pennsylvania, including the following areas, in Ohio, Ashtabula Inland, Ashtabula Lakeshore, Cuyahoga, Geauga, Lake, Lorain, Mahoning, Medina, Portage, Summit and Trumbull. In northwest Pennsylvania, Crawford, Northern Erie and Southern Erie. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall from thunderstorms is expected tonight across portions of northeast Ohio and northwest Pennsylvania. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible overnight into early Thursday morning, with locally higher amounts possible. Rainfall rates up to 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible with the strongest thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
